alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 11:42PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Warrick, northeastern Gibson and Pike Counties through 1130 PM CDT/1230 AM EDT/... At 1041 PM CDT/1141 PM EDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Oakland City to near Petersburg to 7 miles west of Jasper. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Oakland City around 1045 PM CDT. Winslow around 1145 PM EDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 29 and 52. Interstate 64 in Indiana near Mile Marker 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
